intro: Hedypnois mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius starfish plant, is a rare and unique species native to the island of Mauritius. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It features woody stems and produces small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
